item.title: Oil (part 2)
item.description: After saying last week that I was spending too much time thinking about energy and oil stocks, I pretty much spent the weekend thinking only about that. I was mainly thinking about the current global situation we’re in. I read a lot of articles and listened to several interviews, and I got the feeling that most if not all of the individuals who follow the sector closely do so because they understand how fundamental and ubiquitous energy is to our everyday lives, in a way that most of us don’t.

item.title: Oil and Gas
item.description: This post will be slightly more philosophical in nature and a bit longer than usual. To make up for that, I promise some concrete take-aways and action items. Two concepts I’d like to explore: the concept of “circle of competence”, its implications and misuses why opportunities exist Circle of Competence Buffet has popularized the importance of staying within our circle of competence when it comes to investing.
